reviewText:

Gameplay seems like the sort that would go really well on an ipad" but it also works well on a P.C.

Music seems good almost a bit hypnotic .

The game starts you off easy moving your soliders from  your base and taking over the enemies.
You think
recommended: but it gradually ramps up the difficulty and you'll find your self racing to keep up with the incoming attacks.\nYou can buy various upgrades as you earn more points
hoursPlayed: to improve your chances.\nOverall the game seems well made and i haven't noticed any issues in the half hour that i've played so far.\nGive it a go if you like this type of game

reviewText: FROM THE CREATOR OF CONTROL CRAFT 1, A POPULAR FLASH GAME!\n\nAmusing little strategy game where you must decide when and where to send troops to find the enemy troops. As you lose troop count" 1:1 for each point of damage you deal in the beginning
date: you have to time it rather than simply send hordes of small troops in. The ability to resize the game window to any size and shape you like is a very good boon
recommended: as long as you have at least an 800x600 display resolution for it to work. It's rather difficult in the very beginning (until you unlock perks) and at the very end (when you have to play a lot more tactically). Good for casual play on a mobile device; I suspect it was designed for one due to the wide screen
hoursPlayed: bright buttons and 'drag and drop' gameplay. Also the think European accents are a hoot for an American like me."

reviewText: Control Craft 2 is really great indie RTS. It reminded me Eufloria, but instead of trees and seeds, here we have bases and guns (I love it very muсh :D). Gameplay is simple - you need capture all bases on map using units. Controls in this game - its just mouse, no need keyboard. I think only 1 thing, what I dont like - is no fullscreen (alt + enter not working), I hope devs add it in future updates.

reviewText:
I remember playing the same game on my ipad a few years back and I had a great time playing it then.

The game's map can extend both vertically and horizontally, so map sizes can be pretty big.In some levels there are two plaforms which can not be reached directly by ground troops, instead you must first capture air-troop-cloning aircrafts and send airborne troops from them. Coupled with the cool background music and various sound effects, it can feel pretty tense sometimes while playing.The surviving troop chart at the end of each level is also very interesting.

There're a fair amount of elements in this game, and the graphics are nice, fans of casual RTS games should have a try!
voteText: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is a enjoyable, addictive and challenging game which you can play for hours. I lik'd 95% of the game due some facts that's a great potential about very well concept of fast thinking style game. The art, music, voice acting and graphics, gameplay are great and plus 10/10 though. On the other hand in some cases the gameplay feels unbalanced in some missions that makes harder(last levels only) even with the upgrades. Only thing i may suggest if apply is a reset upgrades/stats button if it's possible.

There's one upgrade page(Skills) in the shop which contain 14:

6 troop(ground, armored and air) upgrades
8 others heavily useful(lightning strike, nuke, freeze and backup).

A tip: take the time to learn what works best for you.
A tip: Jet Packs is mostly the key of victory.

You'll face 27 missions which will grant you 1+ star per mission so choose correctly because there isn't way to roll back the upgrades.

This game is basically about speed over any kind of strategy. You need conquer big/barracks, armorys, jumpers and towers by moving on it. Besides sometimes you need to be smart do letting the enemy decrease the number  of the capture points while you keep increasing your amount of troops so when the enemy capture point is close to 0-5 then send all your troops there making the capture very easy. It helped me a lot.

At least I haven't found any error or something that prevents normal operation of the game. The game run very smooth, it's clear and satisfactory good. I would highly recommend this game to everybody who interested in challenge your mental/hands skills. i dare you! :D

reviewText:
Control Craft 2 is a strategy game set in a futuristic time, looking for the player to interact with different towers to achieve win each, but there are enemies that prevent us from taking them. This is where the game features a new mechanic that i never seen before, every soldier makes a certain damage to structures, other towers have an exact life, and if this an enemy one, time to time increases as ours. The life of these is based both on damage / level that our soldiers have, for example if our tower has 50 of life, the first soldier will do 18 damage, the second 11, and so is wasting away. The truth this game impressed me with this strategy, they have improve some respects, sounds are repetitive, the graphics a bit simple, but all in all is a good game.

7,5/10.

Control Craft 2 es un juego de estrategia ambientado en un tiempo futurista, busca que el jugador interactue con distintas torres para que logre conquistar cada una de ellas, pero hay enemigos que nos impiden tomarlas. Aquí es donde el juego destaca una nueva mecánica que nunca antes había visto, cada soldado hace un determinado daño a las estructuras, las demás torres tienen una vida exacta, y si es enemiga cada cierto tiempo esta aumenta al igual que la nuestra. La vida de estas se basa al mismo tiempo en el daño/nivel que nuestros soldados tienen, por ejemplo si nuestra torre tiene 50 de vida, el primer soldado hará 18 de daño, el segundo 11, y así va decayendo. La verdad me impresionó este juego con esta estrategia, algunos aspectos los mejoraría, los sonidos son repetitivos, los gráficos un poco simples, pero dentro de todo es un buen juego.

7,5/10.

reviewText: My original review was very harsh, but for a justified reason. I was angry that the game was the same as the free version available online, and that the game didn't offer anything new. Now that i've looked into the publisher and the developers, i understand that the game was released to fund updates to the game and add new features. I find this style of RTS / statergy very entertaining but it's very rare, meaning it'll be hard for you to find anything that is better than this. If you want to help this game develop then you should buy, but if you want to play a polished, content full game, then wait until a couple of updates have been released!
Very simple game that has a lot of potential
It's kind of a tower defense with a nice soldier theme. In the beginning it looked pretty easy, but there are some really hard stage as you advance in the game. It's a great game for the price.

It's a fast paced and challenging game. Requires patience and some strategy involved.\n\nAlthough this game would probably be best played on a touchsceen for fast deployment of troops, a mouse would work fine too but it takes some practice.

reviewText:
This game could have been good. I'm a fan of really stripped down RTS games. For example, I've played many hours of Galcon Fusion. Control Craft 2 has the bones of a game like that, with just a few changes it could be a good game. Unfortunately there are too many things wrong with it in its current form:

--It's short. I played through 3/4 of the available stages in just an hour and a half with no prior experience of the game.
--It was ported from a FTP mobile game and still retains many features of that which should have been changed. It still has banner ads in it and lacks a full screen option!
--It is poorly documented. I still haven't figured out how to unlock a bunch of major upgrades even though I've almost completed the game. (Technically, I guess I'm not certain they can be unlocked.) This is very frustrating.

So I wouldn't recommend buying this game, not in its current form. That said, my first hour of play was a positive experience. If the developer ever wanted to clean this up for a proper PC release, I'd be interested.

reviewText: Got about 1/2 - 2/3 down the first line.  Challenge is making you make tough descisions and being harder than Just do what you did everywhere else
date: not Islands and Zeplins.  Those levels are total BS.  On Islands, Green goes over the 50 reinforcements cap while Red keeps you pressured and they don't attack each other, leaving you low on troops every time and here come 200+ green troops.  Game Over.  No way around it.  You can't capture any points because Red re-caps them and holds you off until Green destroys you.  Zeplins sends an insta-kill giant robot after you.  That doesn't add to the fun or challenge of the level, it just adds an artificial time limit, and when you lose those air-troop posts, you lose the level.\n\nAlso, this is NOT RTS!  RTS is Starcraft, Age of Empires/Mythology and the like, not this crap.  This would be better off a free game on the internet, not one to buy on Steam.
